channel.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
channel.description:
The idea for lore is that it is a foreign government trying to take over the Blue Dragon from within. There is a max of 4 players in the Republic at once and they Spawn with the General and The Politician. The General will be replaced with the oldest non-Politician player. The Politician will not be replaced on death.
> # [color = "Cyan"] The General [/color] :shield: :crossed_swords: > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Killer [/color]** > > Day Ability: Tactics - Target Republic member will have their primary Ability kill their Target in additional to it's other effects. Other Republic members will be prevented from visiting the player that is attacked this way. Can be used Day 1(Unlimited) > > Night Ability: Rough up - Target player will be prevented from visiting the Republic.(Unlimited)
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Politician [/color] :shield: :crossed_swords: >**[color = "Cyan"] Republic Special [/color]** > Passive: Diplomatic Immunity - You are immune to attacks by the blue dragon and for the first 3 nights you will be immune to all attacks. You will appear to be BD to Investigative Ability's. > > Day Ability: Drugged Wine - Poison target player. They will die in 2 nights. Bypasses night immunity. (4 uses) > > Night ability 1: Campaign - Convert target player to the Republic. (Unlimited. 1 day cooldown) > Night ability 2: Private relations - Discover target players faction. If anything happens to them tonight you will know. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Diplomat and Observer
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Spy [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Investigative[/color]** > > Day ability: Track - Learn who target player visits tonight. (4 uses) > > Night ability: Bug - Learn who visits target player tonight. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Hunter and the Knight
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Soldier [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Offensive[/color]** > > Day ability: Strike - If your target survives an attack then bleed them. (1 use) > > Night ability 1: Strong arm - Prevent visits to target non-Republic player. (Unlimited) > Night ability 2: Reinforce - Prevent visits to target Republic player. (2 uses)
Converted from the Butler and Drunk
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Saboteur [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Offencive [/color]** > Passive: Trickery - You are immune to Occupy and Redirect > > Day ability: Empower - Sabotage will bypass occupy immunity tonight. > > Night ability: Sabotage - Your first target will target your second. If you make them self target they will think they were occupied. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Court Wizard and Physician
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Mortician [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Support [/color]** > > Day ability: Heal - The entire Republic will be healed tonight. (1 use) > > Night ability 1: Wipe - Target players journal will not be shown if they die tonight. (3 uses) > Night ability 2: Defile - Choose what class target player flips as. (2 uses)
Converted from the Princess.
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Mistress [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Investigative [/color]** > Passive - Royal blood > > Day ability: Leak - Gosip will tell you the player's exact class tonight. (2 uses) > > Night ability: Gosip - Learn target players class type. Does not count as a visit. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Mystic
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Seer [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Social [/color]** > > Day ability 1: Telepathy - Send all players an anonymous message. (2 uses) > Day ability 2: Private Matters - Your whispers will be hidden tonight. (2 uses) > > Night ability: Mind read - Read target players journal. Does not count as a visit. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Noble
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Lord [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Social [/color]** > Passive - Royal blood > > Day ability 1: Political Pressure - Force target player to vote for another and stop further voting. (2 uses) > Day ability 2: Noble twins - This trial your vote counts for 2. (2 uses) > > Night ability: Insider information - Learn all the whisper your target made last night and all whispers they made this night. Does not count as a visit. (Unlimited)
Converted from the Mercenary
> # [color = "Cyan"] The Freelancer [/color] > **[color = "Cyan"] Republic Support [/color]** > > Night ability 1: Close off - Prevent all non-Republic players from visiting target player. (3 uses) > Night ability 2: Cold Blood - Kill target player if they accused a Republic member yesterday. (1 use)
The hardcounter
> # [color = "steblue"] The Diplomat [/color] :crossed_swords: > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Investigative [/color]** > Passive: Envoy - Immune to Republic attacks once > > Night ability 1: Interview - Discover if target player is part of the Republic. (Unlimited) > Night ability 2: Dominance - If target player attacks someone then kill them. You will not know if you did anything and you wont receive results from the attack. (Unlimited. 2 day cooldown)

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Or illusionist

Not otherwise useful

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
While I would love for the Sheriff to work like that. It doesn’t and I’m not going to try to suggest we change that in every faction post I make Ad nauseum. Also making the sheriff work like that would not change the fact that it is a soft counter. Everything is a soft counter.

Plus the deduction isn’t with the sheriff knowing who is bad but rather everyone else knowing who is sheriff. It’s kinda the whole point of classes like Scorned to throw a wrench into that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
You know what also isn’t deduction

Knowing someone is a member of the other faction with a click of a button

I worked hard to click that button

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
There is something wrong with them. Throne Of Lies is a game based around DEDUCTION. Knowing what the opposing faction is at the start of the game is not deduction. Smite is also overpowered.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Except smite
I despise smite

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Orrrr

Keep it the same

Nothing wrong with sheriff or pally

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

The Diplomat

This is the only thing I dislike. Factions don’t need a soft counter in a game based around deduction. Just rework sheriff so it can find all enemy factions.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Also that is a very interesting take on General, allowing other player’s primary abilities to do killing

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
But I really like your layout, but it could be a liability, not having the Politician EVER be replaced.

Also dude my CW has been waiting for your feedback

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Fixed it.

Made Bug into Track and make scout into Bug

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
But Spy’s Scout could conflict with Sheriff’s Scout in the system, do you got some other names for that ability?

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
So it’s like half-Cult half-Unseen, and classes are really well laid out

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
UncannyLuck:

Also it could be fool or Merc guard.

That’s why the ability isn’t useless.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
Yeah but then he gets converted. Also it could be fool or Merc guard.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
UncannyLuck:

lets the general lock him down preventing his kill/investigation.

Again. If he gets attacked, and then gets prevented from visiting someone that isn’t jailed then he’s found a scum. However if he’s using a kill that could still be better than if he wasn’t prevented.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
Eh, it prevents getting randomly killed by the Republic and lets the general lock him down preventing his kill/investigation.

And the kill he does have will realistically only see use like 5 times max assuming he’s able to divine who the general will use to attack. It’s the same problem as old smite - it’d be better just to check the guy.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The description is right. One time Immunity is still Immunity.

It’s definitely more than anyone else gets automatically. Especially compared to Sheriff or Paladin

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

I would disagree. The Diplomat has immunity to the Republic’s attacks and his kill is Unlimited

He has a one time immunity unless the description is wrong.

Also I thought Enforcer didn’t prevent. Huh. Well I’ll retract my complaint there then.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
UncannyLuck:

Also can general use Tactics on The Politician?

Yes. You would do this if you are paranoid about the Diplomat killing you. However it would leave him open to Knights or Hunter’s

UncannyLuck:

You gave them an investigative class that can find them, not a hard counter. Paladin gets smite and Diplomat is arguably weaker than Pally. And that’s ignoring that any one of four members could be attacking which makes them harder to find.

I would disagree. The Diplomat has immunity to the Republic’s attacks and his kill is Unlimited.

UncannyLuck:

Tbh aside from the overuse of prevention, I’d rather see the Unseen/Cult buffed.

There is only 3 classes that can prevent. The General’s only prevents a specific player under specific situations which can sometimes be incriminating anyway. So there are only 2 that can really use it effectively. If you look at the unseen you will see that there are 4 classes with visit prevention: Poacher, Enforcer, Sage and Sellsword.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That has NOT been confirmed nor denied. I did ask and they basically shrug.

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: UncannyLuck
item.description:
You gave them an investigative class that can find them, not a hard counter. Paladin gets smite and Diplomat is arguably weaker than Pally. And that’s ignoring that any one of four members could be attacking which makes them harder to find.

Tbh aside from the overuse of prevention, I’d rather see the Unseen/Cult buffed.

Also can general use Tactics on The Politician?

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
They will be adding more classes right tho?

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
We can always change their mind

-I say as I pick up my sledge hammer-

Don’t mind me I got a couple of things to do

Read full topic

item.title: [Faction Suggestion] The Republic
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
They won’t. It’s already been confirmed. This is far more likely for FoL.

Read full topic
